pullRequest.title: Fix redundant workflow context updates for finished workflows
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issues

 My PR addresses the following Helix issues and references them in the PR description:
Fixes #1582

Description

 Here are some details about my PR, including screenshots of any UI changes:
If the workflow has been finished before, there is no need to update the workflow context.
In this PR, this behavior has been fixed and optimized.

Tests


 The following tests are written for this issue:
TestContextRedundantUpdates
More test will be added to this file as we move toward reducing context writes

Commits

My commits all reference appropriate Apache Helix GitHub issues in their subject lines. In addition, my commits follow the guidelines from "How to write a good git commit message":

Subject is separated from body by a blank line
Subject is limited to 50 characters (not including Jira issue reference)
Subject does not end with a period
Subject uses the imperative mood ("add", not "adding")
Body wraps at 72 characters
Body explains "what" and "why", not "how"

commit.message:
Fix redundant workflow context updates for finised workflows

If the workflow has been finished before, there is no need to update the worklfow context.
In this commit, this behavior has been fixed and optimized.

nodes.bodyText: This update is not necessary. When there is a job that needs to be scheduled, we update the workflow context there. If there is no job, then we do not need to update the workflow context
More tests will be added to this file as we move toward reducing context writes
